tutorial.quick_start.introduction.descri:
This game is [key.flavour.negative](hard.) Prepare to [key.flavour.negative](die a lot.)
Before getting into the meat of things, there is an [key.flavour.important](in-built), [key.flavour.important](pseudo-wiki) in this game.[key.style.break_small]Hold [key.control.control_mod] when you see [key.flavour.important](coloured) text.[key.style.break_small]If the text [key.flavour.important](glows), you can [key.flavour.important](click) on it to read more. [key.mechanic.tutorial_text](Try it!).
Anyway, I know this is a lot to read at once - don't feel pressured. If you just want the bare essentials, I recommend the [key.flavour.important](Basics), [key.flavour.important](Controls) and [key.flavour.important](Attack Controls) sections.
These are all you need to know to start playing the game, but feel free to read on if you like :)
tutorial.quick_start.basics.description:
When you enter the [key.flavour.important](Dungeon), your goal is to reach the [key.flavour.important](next floor) by whatever means possible until you reach the end of the [key.flavour.important](Dungeon.)
Floors are [key.flavour.important](randomly generated) each run and contain a multitude of [key.flavour.negative](enemies) for you to fight, as well as some [key.flavour.positive](tantalizing loot) for you acquire.
[key.flavour.important](Chests) will spawn throughout the [key.flavour.important](Dungeon) and can be opened to acquire better gear.
[key.flavour.important](Inventory Management) plays a large role in this game. You can open your inventory with [key.control.inventory].
You will [key.mechanic.damage](inevitably take Damage) during your run.[key.style.break_small]When this happens, you can [key.flag.healing](Heal) using your [key.item_tag.flask] by pressing [key.control.quick_heal].
You can use your [key.item_tag.flask] a number of times equal to your [key.stat.flask_charges.max], which is [key.variable.static](2) by default.
You can restore your [key.stat.flask_charges] by reaching a [key.mechanic.fountain].
One [key.mechanic.fountain] spawns each floor and will [key.flavour.positive](fully restore) your [key.stat.flask_charges].

tutorial.quick_start.controls_part_2.des:
Attacking in this game is similar to other melee slasher games, such as [key.flavour.important](Mordhau) and [key.flavour.important](Chivalry). If you've played those, it will help in your understanding, but don't worry if you haven't.
Your attacks are directional, with no fixed attack patterns.
The angle of your attack is determined by your [key.flavour.important](mouse movement). You will essentially attack 'opposite' the direction you moved your mouse.
For example, if you move your mouse up and to the left before attacking, you will start an attack from the top left of your view and swing downards to the bottom right.
Your attacks for each hand when [key.mechanic.dual_wielding] are controlled independetly, with [key.control.attack1] for your [key.flavour.important](Main Hand) and [key.control.attack2] for your [key.flavour.important](Offhand).
Additionally, some weapons are capable of [key.flavour.important](Thrusting) attacks, which are activated by using [key.control.attack_thrust] (scroll up by default).
[key.flavour.important](Thrusting) attacks can likewise be started from the left and right sides determined by your mouse movement.

key.mechanic.tutorial_text.tooltip.descr:
You can click on this panel to drag it around!
In fact, you can even open another tooltip by clicking [key.mechanic.tutorial_text_two](here!)
key.mechanic.tutorial_text_two.tooltip.d:
You can show as many tooltips as you want.
You can also [key.flavour.important](Left Click) outside a tooltip to close [key.flavour.important](all) tooltips.
If you [key.flavour.important](Right Click) outside a tooltip, you will close everything [key.flavour.important](except the first) tooltip you opened.
tutorial.quick_start.combat.description:
[key.flavour.important](Combat) is about [key.flavour.positive](timing). Attacking at the wrong time, or failing to captilise on an opportunity, can result in a quick trip back to the surface.
The [key.flavour.important](flow) of combat is dictated by [key.mechanic.block](Blocks), [key.mechanic.parry](Parries) and [key.stat.posture].
[key.style.title](Blocking and Parrying)[key.style.break_small]You can [key.mechanic.block] an attack by holding [key.control.block]. If you raise your [key.mechanic.block] [key.mechanic.parry_window](just before) an attack lands, you will instead [key.mechanic.parry] the attack.
Upon successfully [key.mechanic.parry](Parrying) an attack, your [key.mechanic.parry_window] will be extended by [key.variable.static](0.5 seconds), allowing for you to [key.mechanic.parry] multiple attacks in quick succession if you continue to hold your [key.mechanic.block]
If you miss-time a [key.mechanic.parry], [key.flavour.positive](don't panic!) Hold your [key.mechanic.block] and absorb as much [key.mechanic.damage] as you can with your [key.stat.posture].
These are the basics of [key.mechanic.block](Blocking). There are several more sub-mechanics built into the system such as [key.mechanic.block_guard], [key.mechanic.kick](Kicking), [key.mechanic.stability] and [key.mechanic.guard_break](Stability Breaks) - don't feel pressured to read these right now though.
[key.flavour.important](Combat is fluid, and you'll know when you're doing well.)
tutorial.quick_start.combat_part_2.descr:
[key.style.title](Resources)[key.style.break_small]Your [key.flavour.important](most important) resources for combat are [key.stat.stamina], [key.stat.posture] and ofcourse, [key.stat.health].
Lets cover these one at a time briefly.
[key.style.title_small](Health)[key.style.break_small]The most important resource. If it runs out, you [key.mechanic.death](Die).
You can [key.flavour.positive](restore) your [key.stat.health] by using your [key.item_tag.flask].
[key.style.title_small](Stamina)[key.style.break_small]If you run out of [key.stat.stamina] at the wrong time you can put yourself in a tough situation.
All attacks consume [key.stat.stamina] based on your weapons [key.mechanic.heft].[key.style.break_small][key.mechanic.block](Blocking) an attack likewise consumes [key.stat.stamina] based on [key.mechanic.heft].
[key.style.title_small](Posture)[key.style.break_small][key.stat.posture] is effectively a 'second health pool' that gets used up when you [key.mechanic.block] an attack.[key.style.break_small]As long as you don't reach [key.flavour.important](0) [key.stat.posture] after a [key.mechanic.block], you will take [key.flavour.positive](no damage)
Enemies in the [key.flavour.dungeon] also have [key.stat.posture]. When an enemy reaches [key.variable.static](0) [key.stat.posture] they suffer a [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy] and become [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned)
[key.mechanic.stun](Stunned) enemies can then be [key.mechanic.execute](Executed) by striking their [key.mechanic.weak_point].
tutorial.quick_start.power.description:
You get stronger in the [key.flavour.dungeon] through a combination of [key.flavour.positive](better loot) and [key.mechanic.experience].
When you gain enough [key.mechanic.experience] you'll [key.mechanic.level_up]. When you level up you gain [key.variable.static](2) [key.mechanic.attribute_points] and [key.variable.static](1) [key.mechanic.class_level].
You can spend these points in your [key.flavour.important](Character Sheet), which you can open by pressing [key.control.player_card].
[key.style.title_small](Attribute Points)[key.style.break_small][key.mechanic.attribute_points] allow you to [key.flavour.positive](increase) [key.flavour.important](one) of your [key.stat.category.core](Core Stats) for each point you spend.
A good attribute to level if you're unsure is [key.stat.constitution], which increases your [key.stat.health.max] and [key.stat.stamina.max].
Depending on the build you want to try, you may want to level [key.stat.strength] or [key.stat.dexterity].[key.style.break_small]These stats will help increase your [key.mechanic.damage] depending on the weapon you're using.
You can see the [key.flavour.important](scalings) for each particular weapon by holding [key.control.control_mod] while hovering over the weapon in your inventory.
The other [key.stat.category.core](Core Stats) do not offer much benefit as of now - [key.stat.mind] and [key.stat.willpower] will be used for [key.mechanic.spellcasting] [key.mechanic.class](Classes) once they have been implemented.
[key.style.title_small](Class Levels)[key.style.break_small][key.mechanic.class_level](Class Levels) allow you to [key.mechanic.level_up_class](Level Up) a [key.mechanic.class].
In the future, we plan to support [key.mechanic.multiclassing], but for now, [key.class.fighter] is the only [key.mechanic.class] in the game.
Each [key.mechanic.class_level] you put into a [key.mechanic.class] will grant you [key.variable.static](1) [key.mechanic.class_skill_point](Skill Point).
This [key.mechanic.class_skill_point] can be used to acquire [key.mechanic.skills] in the leveled [key.mechanic.class].
You can see your [key.mechanic.skills] by opening your [key.flavour.important](Character Sheet) by pressing [key.control.player_card] and clicking on the [key.flavour.important](Class Tab).
